page.title: 09LONGHOPE VILLAGE
page.content: 1To find out about Longhope we interviewed{Ian Cameron}at the{Post {Office}. He is the chairman of the { {Parish Council}and of several other committees. He was born in the village and used to grow plums. His family is still involved in this work. The village is lively and enterprising. It offers employment as well as accomodating commuters. There are 2 schools in the village, churches and a lively community spirit. There is a {recreation ground}which was bought by public subscription as a war memorial. The annual fete pays for its upkeep. It has never been a charge on the rates. There is a{parish charity, } dating at least back to 1760(vestry fire destroyed prior records). This now takes the form of cheques for old people to pay for winter heating.
